title: Communauté d'agglomération du Bassin de Bourg-en-Bresse
text:
Communauté d'agglomération du Bassin de Bourg-en-Bresse is the "<a href="communaut%C3%A9%20d%27agglom%C3%A9ration">communauté d'agglomération</a>", an <a href="Communes%20of%20France%23Intercommunality">intercommunal</a> structure, centred on the <a href="Communes%20of%20France">city</a> of <a href="Bourg-en-Bresse">Bourg-en-Bresse</a>. It is located in the <a href="Ain">Ain</a> <a href="departments%20of%20France">department</a>, in the <a href="Auvergne-Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes</a> <a href="regions%20of%20France">region</a>, eastern <a href="France">France</a>. It was created in January 2017 by the merger of the former "Communauté d'agglomération de Bourg-en-Bresse" with 6 former <a href="communaut%C3%A9%20de%20communes">communautés de communes</a>. Its seat is in Bourg-en-Bresse. Its population was 132,380 in 2017, of which 41,527 in Bourg-en-Bresse proper.
Composition.
The communauté d'agglomération consists of the following 74 communes:
